title: kimi_to_semi_blue_(idolmaster)
body:
A song and set of [[official alternate costume|costume]]s from [[Gakuen Idolmaster]]. The group version is performed by [[Shiun Sumika]], [[Himesaki Rinami]], and [[Arimura Mao]].

Most of the idols have a variation of Mao's costume as an alternate for their debut SSRs.

h4. Examples
* !post #7871449: [[Arimura Mao]]
* !post #7871451: [[Shiun Sumika]]
* !post #7871452: [[Himesaki Rinami]]
* !post #7871470

h4. External links
* "Official Music Video on YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YsYrh_51cC4]

title: kagamine_rin_(future_style)
body:
A [[list_of_project_diva_modules|module]] for [[Kagamine Rin]] in the [[Project Diva (series)|]] games that makes her appear [[aged up|older]], by giving her [[very long hair]], and a change in outfit of from wearing shorts to a skirt to make her outfit design to look more like [[Hatsune Miku]]'s.

It is also common for artists to give Rin medium or large breasts in her future style, instead of Rin’s usual small or flat chest.

The original design for Furture Style was made by illustator and PV producer; [[Tamura Hiro]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Project Diva modules]]

title: kagamine_rin_(ame)
body:
A [[list_of_project_diva_modules|module]] for [[Kagamine Rin]] in the  [[project_diva_(series)|Project Diva]] game series. This module is associated with the song [[kagamine_hachi-hachi_hana_no_kassen_(vocaloid)|Kagamine HachiHachi Flower Fight]] by by Moja-P (music) and Niregiru (lyrics).

It consists of a [[blue_jacket|blue]] [[happi]] with [[gold_trim|gold trimmings]] and [[wheat print]] designs, held with a [[red_sash|red]] [[obi|sash]]. The left side of the happi is [[open_clothes|left loose]], exposing a [[sarashi]], as well some [[flower tattoo]] on Rin's [[breast_tattoo|chest]] and [[shoulder_tattoo|left arm]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Project Diva modules]]

title: fishnet_leotard
body:
A [[leotard]] fully or partially made out of [[fishnets]].
If the leotard does cover at least the upper legs, do not use this tag. Use [[fishnet bodystocking]] instead.

title: fishnet_bodystocking
body:
A [[bodystocking]] made out of [[fishnets]]. If there is nothing beneath the fishnets, then the characters skin will be fully visible.

h4. See also

* [[fishnet leotard]]

title: faerie_knights_(fate)
body:
Knights who serve Queen [[Morgan le Fay (fate)|]] in the [[avalon le fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]]. They have been granted the True Names of [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]] from proper history, giving them special abilities. This tag applies if [b]all three[/b] are present in an image. [spoiler]They are also known as the [b]Calamity Trio[/b] due to their connections with the three calamities.[/spoiler]
* [[Barghest (fate)|Faerie Knight Gawain]]
* [[Baobhan Sith (fate)|Faerie Knight Tristan]]
* [[Melusine (fate)|Faerie Knight Lancelot]]
While she never appeared in the Lostbelt, [[Britomart (fate)|]] was considered a Faerie Knight after the Chaldea Faerie Knight Cup event.

This tag can also be used for the prior generation of knights that served [[Aesc (fate)|]] if at least three are present.
* [[Mash Kyrielight|Faerie Knight Galahad]]
* [[Habetrot (fate)|Faerie Knight Totorot]]
* [[Ector (fate)|Black Knight]]
* [[Setanta (fate)|Grimr]]
* [[Wryneck (fate)|]]

title: prince_hongzhou
body:
[b]Hongzhou[/b] (Chinese:弘昼, Manchurian Script: ᡥᡠᠩᠵᡝᠣ) (5 January 1712 – 2 September 1770), formally known as Prince He, was a Manchu prince of the [[Qing dynasty]]. 

Unlike his brothers Hongli and Hongshi, Hongzhou chose to avoid being involved in rivalry over the succession to their father's throne. He was known to have pretended to be crazy and feminine.

title: gouged_eye
body: An eye that has been poked or removed from its socket.

title: x-shaped_pupils
body:
When a character's pupils are shaped like an X. Not to be confused with [[+ +]] or [[x x]].

h4. Examples

h4. See also

A standalone question mark in the image, either inside or outside a [[speech bubble]]. Usually denotes wonder, [[confused|confusion]], or curiosity.

This should not be used for question marks that are part of an ordinary sentence.

h4.  See also

* [[...]], [[!?]], [[!]], [[!!]], [[...?]]
* [[spoken question mark]]
* [[confused]]

title: trieste_(rooftop_lunch_break)_(azur_lane)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Trieste (azur lane)|]].

She is wearing a [[school uniform]] with [[white shirt|white]], [[short sleeves|short sleeved]], [[shirt]] with added [[blue sailor collar|dark blue]], borderline [[black sailor collar]]. title: wa2000_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Walther WA 2000]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] done in a [[half updo]], [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and wears a black [[blazer]], [[red necktie]], [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

A total [[tsundere]] towards everyone. Based off her in-game lines this is due to her viewing herself solely as a weapon and finding it hard to effectively communicate with others as a result. The tone of her lines can also depend based on language, with the JP voice lines being a lot harsher on the tsuntsun than the CN text lines. She's also infamous for being a terrible cook.

She is voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]]. In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], WA2000 appears as [[Makiatto (girls' frontline 2)|]].

The leader of the abandoned [[Isomer (girls' frontline)|]]s, acting as the representative of the Isomer Hivemind that had developed in Tallinn. Called "Failed Isomer" in the in-game Enemy Units Index, with her two forms referred to as "Isomer White" and "Isomer Black" in the community.

Originally [spoiler]an Isomer who took over the body of the discarded [[Nimogen (girls' Frontline)|Nimogen]].[/spoiler] By the end of SC, [spoiler]she and the other Isomers were assimilated by M4A1's OGAS, who then subsequently took over the body and was later dubbed [[Dandelion (girls' frontline)|]].[/spoiler]

title: kamen_rider_zero-one
body:
Titular protagonist of [[kamen rider 01 (series)|Kamen Rider Zero-One]], thirtieth show of the Kamen Rider series and very first of the Reiwa generation, with the accession of Emperor Naruhito at the start of May 2019.

Hiden Aruto is a high-school student and aspiring stage comedian who reluctantly takes up his recently-deceased grandfather's position as president of Hiden Intelligence, Japan's leading specialist in HumaGears, humanoid robots with advanced artificial intelligence, in order to be able to access the president-exclusive powers of Kamen Rider Zero-One and protect humanity from rogue HumaGears hijacked by a cyberterrorist organization, with the aid of a specialized military unit and their own Riders.

As Zero-One, Aruto uses keycard-like Progrise Keys to transform into different animal-themed forms, including his default grasshopper-themed Rising Hopper.

title: live_a_live
body:
A 1994 Super Famicom role-playing game developed by Square. The game was initially a failure compared to Final Fantasy, selling only 270,000 copies. However, the HD remake for Nintendo Switch in 2022 and other platforms in 2023 sold 500,000 copies within 3 months and revived interest in the game and its unique systems.

title: oersted
body:
One of the main characters in [[Live A Live]] and main protagonist of The Middle Ages: The Lord of Dark chapter. A knight of the Kingdom of Lucrece who embarked on a journey to rescue Princess [[Alethea]], who was abducted by the Lord of Dark.

[spoilers]At the end of the Middle Ages chapter, Oersted renounces his former ties and titles from Lucrece and took on the name "Odio", accepting his unwanted role as a demon and becoming the Lord of Dark after losing the faith of the people of Lucrece and having no one left to believe in him.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]He, as [[Demon King Odio|Odio, the Lord of Dark]], is playable in the Final Chapter if he is chosen as the protagonist. He is also playable for one turn at the very end of the 2022 remake's true final boss, dealing the final blow to the Sin of Odio.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] in the 2022 remake.
other_names: オルステッド(ライブアライブ)

title: nunholy
body: A small [[hades_(series)|Hades-like]] game developed and published by [[Chowbie]].

title: streibough
body:
Character in [[Live A Live]]'s Middle Ages chapter. Wizard of Lucrece and [[Oersted]]'s closest companion for most of his journey to rescue Princess [[Alethea]] from the clutches of the Lord of Dark.

[spoilers]It is revealed that Streibough is the hidden main antagonist of the Middle Ages chapter, being responsible for the regicide of the King of Lucrece by Oersted's hand by masking the King's appearance as the Lord of Dark and Oersted's descent into becoming [[Demon King Odio|Odio]].[/spoilers]

[spoilers]His soul can be found in the Trial of Heart in the Dominion of Hate, questioning if he is to blame for Oersted's descent into becoming the Lord of Dark.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by Hodoshima Shizuma in the 2022 remake.

title: alethea
body:
Character in [[Live A Live]]'s Middle Ages chapter. The princess of the Kingdom of Lucrece who was abducted by the Lord of Dark pretty early in the chapter, prompting [[Oersted]] to embark on a journey to save her.

[spoilers]At the end of the Middle Ages chapter, she dumped Oersted for [[Streibough]], telling the former he came to save her too late. She kills herself in front of Oersted, her corpse laying on top of Streibough's. This is one of the reasons for Oersted's descent into becoming the Lord of Dark, [[Demon King Odio|Odio]].[/spoilers]

[spoilers]Her soul appears in the Trial of Heart in the Dominion of Hate after obtaining the Guts and Glory Glove, begging for the protagonists to stop Oersted, telling them that he doesn't know what he has become.[/spoilers]

She is voiced by [[Arakawa Miho]] in the 2022 remake.
other_names: アリシア(ライブアライブ)

title: vyshyvanka
body: Vyshyvanka is a casual name for the embroidered shirt in Ukrainian and Belarusian national costumes. Ukrainian vyshyvankas are distinguished by embroidery features specific to Ukrainian embroidery.

title: mavka
body:
Mavka (Ukrainian: Мавка) also Nyavka (Ukrainian: Нявка) is a type of female spirit in Ukrainian folklore and mythology. The Mavka is a long-haired figure, a Soul of the Forest, typically depicted as temptress figures who lure men to their deaths.

The spirits known by this term represented the souls of girls who had died unnatural, tragic or premature deaths, particularly unchristened babies. Mavkas often appear in the form of beautiful young girls who entice and lure young men into the woods, where they "tickle" them to death. Mavkas have no reflection in water, nor do they cast shadows. In some accounts, they were also said to help farmers by looking after cattle and driving out wild animals.

title: uranohoshi_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students who attend the Uranohoshi Girls' High School in [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]], it's a [[serafuku]] and comes in 3 versions.

The main [[summer uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]], [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[grey sailor collar|sailor]] blouse and a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and a [[neckerchief]] with a [[tie clip]]. The neckerchief may also be colored according to class year: students who first enter high school in Season 1 wear [[yellow neckerchief|yellow]], those in their second year wear [[red neckerchief|red]], and those in their third year wear [[aqua neckerchief|aqua]].

The [[winter uniform]] replaces the light blouse with a thicker [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[double-breasted]] one and the neckerchief with a [[bowtie]] matching their neckerchief (although [[Matsuura Kanan|the]] [[kurosawa dia|third]] [[ohara mari|years]] opt to keep the neckerchief instead).

There is also an alternate [[black serafuku]] version of the winter uniform with a [[white neckerchief]] and [[tie clip]], featured in [[love live! sunshine!! the school idol movie over the rainbow|the movie]].

title: forbidden_gundam
body:
[b]GAT-X252 Forbidden Gundam[/b]

A second generation GAT-X mobile suit, the Forbidden gundam was a monstrous assault mobile suit, dedicated to devastating high-speed assaults against enemy fortifications and bases. It bore several unique weapons and systems including: two arm mounted 115mm machine guns, two 88mm backpack mounted railguns, a devastatingly powerful "Plasma Induction Cannon" capable of total annihilation of targets, worst yet the beam could  [b][i]bend[/i][/b] in order to hit moving targets. And finally a heavy scythe for close combat. The entire MS was protected by the now near standard trans-phase shift armor and a powerful electromagnetic field generator known as Geschmeidig Panzer. This unit was deployed by the Terrorist organization [[Blue Cosmos]] and was finally destroyed in combat by [[Yzak Joule]] and his [[Duel Gundam]].

title: dottore_(genshin_impact)
body:
Il Dottore, also known by his codename "The Doctor", is the second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and a major antagonist in [[Genshin Impact]]. He first appeared in the supplementary manga before his first in-game appearance.

Prior to becoming a Fatui Harbinger, he was a researcher from Sumeru known as [b]Zandik[/b]. He was exiled from his homeland for performing unethical experiments and "enhancing" humans. [[Pierro (genshin impact)|]] would later recruit him to join the Fatui. He finds his name "humorously ironic."

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, he is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

title: ayakashi_triangle
body:
Ayakashi Triangle, sometimes abbreviated as AyaTri, is a 2020-to-2023 Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Yabuki Kentarou]]. It has been serialized by publisher Shueisha since June 2020, changing from [[shounen jump|Weekly Shōnen Jump]] magazine to Shōnen Jump+ in April 2022.

The series focuses on exorcist ninja [[Kazamaki Matsuri]], as he tries to defend his childhood friend, the Ayakashi Medium [[Kanade Suzu]], from evil spirits called ayakashi. However, during a battle to save Suzu's life, Matsuri is turned into a girl after being cursed by [[Shirogane (ayatora)|]], the King of Ayakashi. With Suzu's help, Matsuri must adjust to his new feminine form as they deal with both the friendly and the malicious ayakashi they encounter, as well as their growing feelings for each other, all while trying to break Matsuri's curse for him to return to his original form.

h4.Characters

title: sun_quan
body:
[b]Sun Quan[/b] (孫權), courtesy name [b]Zhongmou[/b] (仲謀), posthumously known as Emperor Da of Wu (吳大帝), was the founder of the [[Eastern Wu|Eastern Wu dynasty]], one of the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms of China]]. 

After [[Sun Jian|Sun Jian's]] death in the early 190s, he and his family lived at various cities on the lower Yangtze River, until Sun Ce carved out a warlord regime in the Jiangdong region, based on his own followers and a number of local clan allegiances. When [[Sun Ce]] was assassinated, Sun Quan inherited the lands southeast of the Yangtze River from his brother. 

In winter of 207, the northern warlord [[Cao Cao]] led an army of approximately 220,000 to conquer the south to complete the reunification of China. Two distinct factions emerged at his court on how to handle the situation. One, led by [[Zhang Zhao]], urged surrender whilst the other, led by [[Zhou Yu]] and [[Lu Su]] and with support from a diplomatic mission by [[Zhuge Liang]], opposed Cao Cao. Eventually Sun Quan decided to ally with Liu Bei and employing the combined strategies of Zhou Yu and [[Huang Gai]], they defeated Cao Cao decisively at the Battle of Red Cliffs.

In late 220, [[Cao Pi]], King of Wei, Cao Cao's son and successor, seized the throne and proclaimed himself to be the Emperor of China, ending and succeeding the nominal rule of the Han dynasty. At first Sun Quan nominally served as a Wei vassal with the Wei-created title of King of Wu, but after Cao Pi demanded that he send his son [[Sun Deng]] as a hostage to the Wei capital Luoyang and he refused and declared himself independent by changing his era name. It was not until May 229 that he formally declared himself emperor.

After the death of his original crown prince, Sun Deng, two opposing factions supporting different potential successors slowly emerged. Sun Quan harshly settled the conflict between the two factions by exiling [[Sun He]] and forcing [[Sun Ba]] to commit suicide. Sun Quan died in May 252 at the age of 70 (by East Asian reckoning). He enjoyed the longest reign among all the founders of the Three Kingdoms and was succeeded by his son, [[Sun Liang]]. 

h4. Adaptations in popular media

* [[sun quan (sangokushi taisen)|Sun Quan]] from [[Sangokushi Taisen]]
* [[sun quan (shin sangoku musou)|Sun Quan]] from [[Shin Sangoku Musou]]
* [[Sonken Chuubou (sangoku hime)|Sonken Chuubou]] from [[Sangoku Hime]]
* [[Sonken (koihime musou)|Sonken "Renfa" Chuubou]] from [[Koihime Musou]]
* [[Sonken Chuubou|Shoukyou (Sonken Chuubou)]] from [[Ikkitousen]]

title: mii_(nintendo)
body:
User avatars for [[Nintendo]]'s [[Wii]], [[nintendo 3ds|3DS]], and [[Wii U]] video game systems, appearing too on the [[Nintendo Switch]] in a lesser capacity. Typically [[chibi]] characters, sometimes without legs or arms (though inclusive of hands).

The Wii and the Wii U each have a unique set of Miis that appear as CPUs in Nintendo's games, the most well-known of the Wii set being [[Matt (wii)|]] (マット). However, Nintendo does make unique original Miis when needed; for instance, [[Nikki (swapnote)|]] for [[Swapnote]] and [[Sheila Bell]] for [[Surechigai Meikyuu]].

Numerous Nintendo games, such as [[Mario Kart]] (since Mario Kart Wii) and [[Super Smash Bros.]] allow players to use their Miis as playable characters. In the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series, the generic Miis used to represent the [[Mii Brawler|Brawler]], [[Mii Gunner|Gunner]], and [[Mii Swordfighter|Swordfighter]] types are shown to be based off the default Miis Guest C, Guest F, and Guest B.

Spiritually succeeded by the [[Sportsmate (nintendo)|]]s of [[Nintendo Switch Sports]], even if you can still play with and against Miis in that game.

h4. See also

* [[Mii Brawler]]
* [[Mii Gunner]]
* [[Mii Swordfighter]]

title: amaya_tsubame
body:
A character from [[Gakuen Idolmaster]], voiced by Yukari Amane (天音ゆかり Amane Yukari).

The vice president of Hatsuboshi Academy's student council and its current No.2 idol. Prideful of her abilities, she takes on a more pompous attitude. Though she's strict with herself and others, she's good at looking after them. She's a childhood friend and rival with [[juo_sena|Sena]], and has stated that she would surpass her and become "Prima Stella" in the future.

h4. Appearance
* !post #8482296

* "Gakuen Idolmaster Official Character Bio: Amaya Tsubame":[https://gakuen.idolmaster-official.jp/idol/tsubame//]

title: agent_(girls'_frontline)
body:
First [[Sangvis Ferri]] android seen in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Holding a high position as all combat units are obedient to her commands. She is a master of both combat and command, capable of strategic coordination.

Serene and indifferent, she speaks and acts in a tidy manner. Her language is always respectful even towards her enemy, but she will give harsh titles to anyone other than her master, especially to Griffin & Kryuger.

Agent has [[grey eyes]], [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[black hair]] put up in large [[double bun]]s, and short black [[horns]]. There is a device on her back with a [[cable]] extending from it that plugs into an external [[collar]]. Her armament, hidden beneath a long [[dress]], consists of four boxy [[gun]] barrels on [[mechanical arms]] connected to her hips and legs on the thighs.

She wears a [[maid]] uniform that consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] underneath a long [[black dress]] with [[frilled dress|frilled trim]], [[black gloves]], a [[maid headdress]], [[black panties]], a black [[garter belt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]] that go either to the [[thigh boots|thigh]] or the [[knee boots|knee]], depending on the artist.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3511503: Default
* !post #4535832: 5* Protocol Assimilation

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Agent":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Agent]
other_names: エージェント(ドールズフロントライン)

She has [[red eyes]] and wears a white jacket, [[white gloves]], [[white skirt]], and [[black pantyhose]]. title: soviet_army
body:
The [b]Workers' and Peasants' Red Army[/b], or more known by their shortened name Red Army, was the prime land warfare forces of the [[soviet|Union of Soviet Socialist Republic]]. It was established in 1917 and was in service until 1946 when the army took the official name of "Soviet Army", It was then in service until its dissolution in 1991 following the dissolution of the Soviet Union. The remaining bulk of the military would be integrated into the Russian Armed Forces.

h4.See also
* [[World War II]]
* [[Cold War]]
* [[VDV]]
* [[Soviet Border Troops]]
* [[Soviet Navy]]
* [[Soviet Air Force]]
* [[Soviet Militsiya]]
* Wiki articles: "Workers' and Peasants' Red Army":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army] & "Soviet Army":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Army

title: musical_staff
body:
A set of five horizontal lines and four spaces that each represent a different musical pitch or, in the case of a percussion staff, different percussion instruments. Appropriate [[musical note]]s, depending upon the intended effect, are placed on the staff according to their corresponding pitch or function. Musical notes are placed by pitch, percussion notes are placed by instrument, and rests and other symbols are placed by convention.

When on paper, this is tagged as [[sheet music]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #24648632: Staff with [[treble clef]]

h4. See also

* [[sheet music]]
* [[musical note]]
* [[musical staff print]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Staff (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Staff_(music)

title: musical_staff_print
body:
[[tag group:attire|Clothing]] item or object that has [[musical staff|musical staff]] pattern on it.

h1. See also
* [[musical note print]]
* [[Tag Group:Prints]]

title: marcato_(music)
body:
In musical notation, the marcato symbol is an open vertical wedge (∧) written above or below the [[musical staff|staff]]. It is meant to denote that a note, chord or passage is to be played more forcefully or loudly.

For the horizontal version of the wedge (<), see [[accent mark]].

title: whole_rest
body:
A [[musical note]] denoting a rest (pause) for the length of a whole note. Visually, it appears as a filled in rectangle placed directly below one of the [[musical staff]] lines.

If it is placed directly above one of the staff lines, it is a [[half rest]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20779041

h4. See also

* [[whole note]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Whole note (rest)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whole_note
* "Wikipedia: Rest (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music)

title: akamatsu_kaede
body:
The Ultimate Pianist, and protagonist of [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]]. Used to be called a "Piano Idiot" when she was younger thanks to her constant diligence. Kaede is optimistic and proactive, acting as a leader figure among the students and hoping to cooperate with them to stop the killing game.

She has [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] on top, and wears [[musical note hair ornament]]s. Her school uniform consists of a purple [[sweater vest]] with an orange [[necktie]], along with a purple [[pleated skirt]] with a [[musical staff|musical staff]] print. Also tends to wear a white [[randoseru]].

title: sheet_music
body:
A sheet of [[paper]] bearing [[musical note]]s and symbols used as a reference to play a piece of music.

If the musical notes and symbols are not on paper, use [[musical staff]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[music stand]]

title: half_rest
body:
A [[musical note]] denoting a rest (pause) for the length of a half note. Visually, it appears as a filled in rectangle placed directly above one of the [[musical staff]] lines.

If it is placed directly below one of the staff lines, it is a [[whole rest]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20779047

h4. See also

* [[half note]]
* [[dotted half note]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Half note (rest)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Half_note
* "Wikipedia: Rest (music)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rest_(music)

title: bass_clef
body:
The musical symbol (𝄢) used to designate notes on the bass staff, or in layman's terms, the lower range of notes. This most common of clefs is associated with bass voices, contrabass (a.k.a. [[double bass]]), bass guitar and other low-pitched instruments.

Also known as the [b]F clef[/b].

title: treble_clef
body:
The musical symbol (𝄞) used to designate notes on the treble staff, or in layman's terms, the upper range of notes. This most common of clefs is associated with soprano and alto voices, violin, flute and many other high-pitched instruments. In art, the treble clef is sometimes used as a general symbol for music.

Also known as the [b]G clef[/b].

title: suzumiya_haruhi_no_yuuutsu
body:
Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu ([i]The Melancholy of Suzumiya Haruhi[/i]) is a light novel series by Tanigawa Nagaru, with art by [[Ito Noizi]], which was adapted into a 2006 anime by [[Kyoto Animation]], along with a sequel in 2009, and a feature film, [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Shoushitsu]], in 2010. 

It has also been adapted into a number of videos games, drama CDs, and four official manga series. The first, with art by Mizuno Makoto, was considered a disservice and soon cancelled. The second, by Tsugano Gaku, has fared much better. The third is a spin-off based on [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Shoushitsu]], called [[Nagato Yuki-chan no Shoushitsu]], by [[Puyo (puyotopia)|]]. The fourth is a parody manga, [[Suzumiya Haruhi-chan no Yuuutsu]], also by [[Puyo (puyotopia)|]], which saw a 2009 Original Net Animation adaptation by KyoAni.

[i]Nyoro~n Churuya-san[/i], by [[Eretto]], is an unofficial doujinshi work, but was also given an ONA adaptation by KyoAni.

While mainly known as the [i]Suzumiya Haruhi[/i] series, [i]Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu[/i] refers to the first novel of the series, but is used for many of the adaptations, including the anime and manga.

body:
Titular protagonist of [[kamen rider ex-aid (series)|Kamen Rider Ex-Aid]], twenty-seventh show of the Kamen Rider series and eighteenth of the Heisei generation.

[[Houjou Emu]] is a pediatrics intern at Seito University Hospital, whose double life as the gaming legend "M" attracted the attention of video game developer Genm Corporation, which gave him a Gamer Driver with which he can transform into a Kamen Rider to defeat Bugsters, viruses generated by bugs in Genm software that manifest in the physical world at the expense of their human hosts, even as he has to contend with other Riders who have their own designs for their powers.

As Ex-Aid, Emu uses game cartridge-like Rider Gashats to transform into different forms or summon weapons upgrades.

title: t-64
body:
A second-generation main battle [[tank]] manufactured in Kharkiv, [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[Ukraine]].

First introduced in the 1960s, it was highly advanced for its time, being one of the first tanks to be equipped with composite armor and an autoloader for its 125mm smoothbore cannon, which enabled it to use a three-man crew, keeping the design's weight and size down. It had a compact and powerful diesel engine which gave it superior mobility to the contemporaneous [[T-62]], but had teething problems and its expense prompted the development of the [[T-72]]. Most were originally equipped with an infrared searchlight on the port side of the main gun and had small road wheels.

Notably, it is still in service with the "Ukrainian Ground Forces":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Ground_Forces#Equipment, with various modifications being applied to its tank fleet.

h4. See also

title: kamen_rider_ghost
body:
Lead rider of [[kamen_rider_ghost_(series)|Kamen Rider Ghost]], twenty-sixth show of the Kamen Rider series and seventeenth of the Heisei generation.

Tenkuuji Takeru is an aspiring ghost hunter who died protecting his childhood friend Tsukimura Akari from Ganma, creatures hunting after Eyecons, mysterious eyeball-shaped objects, only to be resurrected by a monk who also gives him a device with which, combined with an Eyecon he received from his supposedly-dead father, to transform into Ghost to fight off the Ganma, with the additional task of finding the fifteen remaining Eyecons in 99 days to make his resurrection permanent.

As Ghost, Takeru uses any Eyecon in his possession to summon Parka Ghosts, hooded jacket-like spirits representing famous historical figures, which grant him various combat forms and abilities.

title: kamen_rider_zi-o
body:
Titular protagonist of [[kamen_rider_zi-o_(series)|Kamen Rider Zi-O]], twenty-ninth show of the Kamen Rider series and twentieth of the Heisei generation, as well as the last, with the abdication of Emperor Akihito at the end of April 2019.

Tokiwa Sougo is an eighteen-year-old high-school student prophesied to become a ruthless tyrant by a girl who claims to have come from fifty years in the future. Determined to defy his fate, he takes up the girl's offer to be trained to become a hero instead, becoming Kamen Rider Zi-O to protect the time-space continuum while encountering other Riders from the Heisei era, another Rider from the future determined to kill him before he becomes the prophesied tyrant, and a mysterious organization tampering with the timeline with Another Riders, monsters based on twisted forms of the Heisei Riders.

As Zi-O, Sougo uses Ridewatches to transform into modified forms of past Heisei-era Riders.

title: kamen_rider_fourze
body:
Titular Rider of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (series)|Kamen Rider Fourze]], twenty-second show of the Kamen Rider series and thirteenth of the Heisei generation, as well as a celebration of the series's 40th anniversary.

[[Kisaragi Gentarou|Kisaragi Gentaro]] is a self-styled delinquent and second-year transferee to Amanogawa High School who wants to make friends with his schoolmates. After witnessing an attack by the Zodiarts, constellation-themed monsters derived from human hosts wielding Zodiart Switches, he receives the Fourze Driver from his childhood friend [[Joujima Yuuki|Jojima Yuuki]] and transforms into Kamen Rider Fourze to fight the Zodiarts. Together with Yuuki and reluctant loner [[Utahoshi Kengo]], Gentaro founds the Kamen Rider Club to investigate potential Zodiarts and urban legends involving past Kamen Riders.

Fourze uses Astro Switches, 40 switch-like devices divided among the Switch Sockets corresponding to his arms and legs, of which four must be equipped at once to allow him to transform, and which can be used to equip his limbs with weapons or change his appearance.

title: kamen_rider_wizard
body:
Titular Rider of [[kamen_rider_wizard_(series)|Kamen Rider Wizard]], twenty-third show of the Kamen Rider series and fourteenth of the Heisei generation, as well as the franchise's first magic-based Rider.

[[Souma Haruto]] is the survivor of a magic ritual under a solar eclipse that turned other human sacrifices like him into Phantoms, monsters that feed on their hosts' despair before killing and then imitating them to spread despair in turn. His ordeal granted him the ability to use magic, and with a set of rings and the Wizardriver given to him by a man in white, he sets off to bring hope and fight his fellow Phantoms as Kamen Rider Wizard.

Wizard's combat abilities are affected by Wizard Rings, which are divided into two types: Transformation Rings (on his left middle finger), which change his appearance and elemental specialty (Flame, Water, Hurricane and Land Styles); and Magic Rings (on his right), which give him miscellaneous powers, such as controlling WizarDragon, his personal Phantom.

title: traditional_media
body:
An artwork drawn with traditional tools without a computer. This is in contrast with "digital media" which dominate Danbooru.

Please use this tag only if you're 100% sure that the image is actually drawn by hand. Use [[faux traditional media]]  for digital images that mimic a hand-drawn/non-CG style.

An image that is partly traditional, but also contains digital elements (e.g. digital [[spot color]]), should receive the additional tag [[mixed media]]. Digital filtering, performed to improve the visibility of the traditional artwork (e.g. color adjustment), rather than as a creative effect or to remove flaws, does not make an image [[mixed media]].

A good way to tell if a drawing is traditional is to look for "analog" or アナログ in kana. You'll find this tag on Pixiv and used on some Japanese artists' sites. (Beware however that some people will tag their image "アナログ" that don't qualify to our standards of the tag).

If the image of the work is a photograph of the work, rather than a scanned work, then the tag [[photo (medium)]] is applicable.

For non-drawn physical art, see [[unconventional media]].

body:

For a [[duel monster]] that makes up the other half of [[Evil Twin's Trouble Sunny]], see [[Luna (DM) (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]].

title: luna_(dm)_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
The tall, [[dark-skinned female|tanned]], and usually quiet partner of [[Sunny (Yu-Gi-Oh!)|]] and the other half of [[Evil Twin's Trouble Sunny]]. As she currently doesn't have her own monster form, she is currently sharing her Pixiv tag with Sunny.

This tag can be applied if Luna is present on the image. If only Sunny is present, tag [[Sunny (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]] instead.

For a [[Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's]] character known as Luna in the dub, see [[Luca (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]].

title: evil_twin's_trouble_sunny
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] The arch-nemesis of the Evil Twins [[Ki-Sikil (yu-gi-oh!)|]] and [[Lil-La (yu-gi-oh!)|]] online celebrity and phantom thieves. Depicted as a smug and cheeky girl with "ojou-sama" archtypical traits.

She is accompanied by her friend [[Luna (dm) (yu-gi-oh!)|Luna]], who as of current does not have her own duel monster form yet, and therefore shared the same Pixiv tag as Sunny. Because of this, this tag is applicable when either of them is present. If only Sunny or Luna is present, tag [[Sunny (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]] or [[Luna (DM) (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]] respectively. If both were present, then apply this tag and their individual tag.

title: armored_dress
body:
A [[dress]] adorned with combat [[armor]], or an entire suit of armor stylized into a dress.

The armor can be light, such as just [[faulds]] or [[kusazuri]], or it can heavy such as adding [[pauldrons]], [[greaves]], [[gauntlets]], and/or other similar pieces. This ensemble does have elegance in mind, but its primary function is for battle rather than social engagements or festivities.

See [[armored skirt]] if only the [[skirt]] is armored, not the entire dress.

h4. See also

body:

An [[Erune]] with [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blue hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She wears a white sideless top along with a [[cape]], a [[blue skirt]] with a [[loose belt]], [[black gloves]], and a [[single earring|single]] [[hoop earrings|hoop earring]] on her left ear. Widely known for her exposed [[armpits]].

Ferry is often seen with her ghosts [[Momo (granblue fantasy)|]], [[Beppo (granblue fantasy)|]], [[Fugee (granblue fantasy)|]], [[Nicola (granblue fantasy)|]], and [[Geegee (granblue fantasy)|]]. Refer to post #3430232 for reference of each ghost.

title: andira_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
2016 Chinese Zodiac character in [[Granblue Fantasy]].

Guardian of the West-Southwest and one of the Twelve Divine Generals, she is the zodiac representative for the Monkey. Often seeing dreams of the utopia her ancestors set out for, she departs on a journey herself after a certain fateful encounter. The unwavering resolve of this monkey goddess makes her an invaluable asset to the crew.

h4. External links

* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki: Andira":https://gbf.wiki/Andira

title: kumbhira_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
2018 Chinese Zodiac character in [[Granblue Fantasy]].

Guardian of the North-Northwest and one of the Twelve Divine Generals, she is the zodiac representative for the Boar. Unlike the divine boars before her, she doesn't possess the blessed might of her ilk, but still she ventures into the skies to prove herself worthy. Little does she know that her sincerity and ambition do more for those around her than any amount of strength ever could.

h4.Official alternate costumes

title: vajra_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
2018 Chinese Zodiac character in [[Granblue Fantasy]]. Guardian of the West-Northwest and one of the Twelve Divine Generals along with her partner [[Garjana]].

She is an [[erune]] with [[dog ears]], [[brown eyes]] and short [[blonde hair]] wearing [[Japanese clothes]] with a [[shimenawa]] on her back, [[brown pantyhose]] and [[platform footwear]]; she wields a [[katana]] as her weapon.

Her alternate costume is a green backless pleated dress with a high waist skirt, grey pantyhose, and a yellow jacket with a red ribbon over the dress. Her hair has a French braid along a flower and a green ribbon.

title: see-through_raincoat
body:
A [[raincoat]] made of clear, [[transparent]] vinyl or the like, similar in style and material to that used in [[transparent umbrella]]s (which are frequently seen together with these coats). The nature of the style makes it very easy to see what is worn underneath. More explicit images frequently exploit this for characters engaging in [[exhibitionism]] to reveal [[underwear]] or [[nude|nudity]] underneath instead of clothing.

Use this tag for when the raincoat is entirely or largely transparent and easy to see through. This tag isn't intended for garments that are mostly opaque, or translucent due to merely being a thin poncho or the like.

h4. See also

* [[raincoat]]
* [[see-through jacket]]
* [[transparent umbrella]]
* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: m4a1_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[M4 Carbine]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[black eyes|eyes]], with a [[green hair|green]] or chartreuse [[streaked hair|streak]] in her hair. She is typically depicted with an [[armband]], [[thighhighs]], [[scarf]], and a [[jacket]] [[jacket around waist|wrapped around her waist]].

She is the squad leader for the [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|]] Squad (consisting of [[M16A1 (girls' frontline)|]], [[M4 SOPMOD II (girls' frontline)|]], and [[ST AR-15 (girls' frontline)|]]). She is soft spoken and has a conflicting personality, being shy yet strong at the same time. She's looking to change this and become a more capable leader.

Has a much more childish voice in contrast to her appearance. Would receive a [[M4A1 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

She is voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]].

title: mexican_army
body:
The [[mexico|Mexican]] Army (Spanish: Ejército Mexicano) is the combined land and air branch and is the largest part of the Mexican Armed Forces; it is also known as the National Defense Army.
The Army is under the authority of the Secretariat of National Defense or SEDENA and is headed by the Secretary of National Defence.

It was the first army to adopt (1908) and use (1910) a self-loading rifle, the Mondragón rifle. The Mexican Army has an active duty force of 261,773 men and women in 2024.

title: hoshi_no_kioku
body:
A 50-minute fan-made [[Touhou]] animated video created by [[SOUND HOLIC]] and released at [[Comiket 73]] in December 2007. Reception was mixed, praising an ambitious project and hiring professional voice actors, but was criticized for being fairly boring with some animation errors. The plot would later be completely invalidated by [[Silent Sinner in Blue]].

Some see it as the predecessor to [[Cookie (touhou)|]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Touhou_Project_Side_Story_~_Memory_of_Stars]

title: avatar:_the_last_airbender
body:
[b]Avatar: The Last Airbender[/b], often abbreviated [b]ATLA[/b], is a [[Nickelodeon]] animated cartoon created by Brian Konietzko and Michael Dante DiMartino.

The story takes place in a world where humans known as benders are able to control and manipulate one of the four elements through [[martial arts]], a practice known as [[element bending|bending]]. The world is divided into four nations represented by each element: the Water Tribe, Earth Kingdom, Fire Nation, and Air Nomads. Peace between them is kept by the Avatar, a powerful bender who is capable of controlling all four elements and is reincarnated after death.

In [b]ATLA[/b], the world has been at war for a hundred years after the Fire Nation attacked the other nations while the Avatar has mysteriously disappeared. In the present, siblings [[Sokka]] and [[Katara]] of the Water Tribe find a boy named [[Aang]] frozen in an iceberg and discover that he is the current Avatar. They join him on a journey to master all four elements and bring balance to the world.

The story is set in a world primarily influenced by Eastern culture and mythology (as well as Inuit), revolving around the reincarnations of the titular Avatar. It would be the beginning of the [[Avatar Legends]] franchise, with its sequel being [[The Legend of Korra]].

Not to be confused with [[James Cameron's Avatar]].

h4. Characters

title: kamen_rider_kiva
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_kiva_(series)|Kamen Rider Kiva]], eighteenth show of the Kamen Rider series and ninth of the Heisei generation.

[[Kurenai Wataru]] is a very shy violin maker living in a "haunted house", who only goes out of his mansion to fight as Kiva against Fangires, stained-glass-themed monsters who feed on human souls.

Kiva's red default form is patterned after a vampire. Other forms include the blue, sword-wielding Garulu Form (werewolf), the green, gun-wielding Bashaa Form (gill-man), and the violet, hammer-wielding Dogga Form (Frankenstein's monster). He can also wield the fused DoGaBaKi form, as well as the almighty Emperor Form and its bat-like Flight Style.

title: qbz-191_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[QBZ-191]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], QBZ-191 appears as [[Qiongjiu (girls' frontline 2)|]].

A chivalrous Doll who makes for a very trustworthy teammate due to her down-to-earth and level-headed demeanor on the battlefield. She is good at handling all kinds of situations, but she finds it unbearable when she herself becomes someone to be protected. Off the battlefield, her aloofness is replaced by a generous and benevolent spirit that makes her an unexpectedly witty conversationalist. She is extremely popular among Dolls and humans alike, though she doesn't seem aware of her gifts.

Illustrated by [[Imoko (imonatsuki)|]].

title: suomi_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Finnish [[Suomi KP/-31]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].  

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and wears a [[blue jacket]] as well as a [[white cape]], resembling a Finnish [[military uniform]] in the 1930s.

title: derek_chauvin
body:
Derek Michael Chauvin is an American former police officer who murdered [[George Floyd]], a 46-year-old African-American man, in Minneapolis, Minnesota. On May 25, 2020, Chauvin knelt on Floyd's neck for about nine minutes while Floyd was handcuffed and lying face down on the street, calling out "I can't breathe," during an arrest made with three other officers. Chauvin was dismissed by the Minneapolis Police Department on May 26 and arrested on May 29. The murder set off a series of protests in Minneapolis–Saint Paul, across the United States and around the world.

Chauvin was a member of the Minneapolis Police Department from 2001 to 2020. In his career, Chauvin had 18 complaints against him in his official record and was involved in three police shootings, one of which was fatal. He received two letters of reprimand for misconduct. He received two medals of valor and two commendation medals during his career.

In early 2021, Chauvin was put on trial for unintentional second-degree murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter of Floyd before a jury in the Minnesota Fourth Judicial District Court. On April 20, he was convicted on all of the charges. On June 25, he was sentenced to 22½ years in prison (with credit given for 199 days time served), with the possibility of supervised release after 15 years (two thirds of his sentence) contingent on factors such as good behavior. Requests to the Minnesota Supreme Court and Supreme Court of the United States for review were denied.

Chauvin pleaded guilty in late 2021 to federal charges of violating Floyd's civil rights by using unreasonable force and ignoring Floyd's serious medical needs. Simultaneously, Chauvin pleaded guilty to violating a 14-year-old boy's civil rights in 2017 by using unreasonable force. In mid-2022, Chauvin was sentenced to 21 years in prison for violating Floyd's civil rights. The federal and state sentences are to run concurrently. The Minnesota Department of Corrections lists Chauvin's anticipated release date on the state sentence as December 10, 2035. For the federal charges, Chauvin will likely be released from prison in the year 2038. Chauvin filed a motion in federal court in mid-November 2023 attempting to vacate his guilty plea.

After the conclusion of the criminal and civil rights cases, Chauvin was transferred in August 2022 from Oak Park Heights prison in Minnesota to FCI Tucson in Arizona, a medium-security federal facility, to serve his sentence. He was stabbed by another inmate at the federal facility on November 24, 2023.

title: patreon_username
body:
The rendering of a page on Patreon found somewhere on an image. The name of the page could be seen in a URL of the page, as just the name next to the [[patreon logo|logo]], or found in a message asking a user to visit the page so long as it's clearly discernible as a Patreon page. Commonly this is a name for the artist or one of their accounts but it does not have to be. If it is a verified name of the artist, tag [[artist name]] as well.

body: The [[loli]] protagonist of the erotic novel [[Josephine Mutzenbacher or The Story of a Viennese Whore as Told by Herself]]. While fifty-two at the time of her death, the narrative in the novel recounts events between when she was five years old and thirteen years old.
other_names: ヨゼフィーネ・ムッツェンバッヒェル

title: josephine_mutzenbacher_or_the_story_of_a_viennese_whore_as_told_by_herself
body:
[[Josephine Mutzenbacher]] or The Story of a Viennese Whore, as Told by Herself (German: Josefine Mutzenbacher oder Die Geschichte einer Wienerischen Dirne von ihr selbst erzählt) is an erotic novel first published anonymously in Vienna, Austria, in 1906. Its content is entirely pornographic and the book has been banned repeatedly.

The plot is framed as first-person narrative memoir by a soon-to-be-dead prostitute recounting her childhood. The book begins when she is five years old and ends when she at age thirteen begins her career as an unlicensed prostitute in order to support her unemployed father.

title: pacific_rim
body:
[i][b]Pacific Rim[/b][/i] is a 2013 American anime-influenced [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] monster film directed by [[Guillermo del Toro]], written by del Toro and Travis Beacham, and starring [[Charlie Hunnam]], [[Idris Elba]], [[Kikuchi Rinko]], Charlie Day, [[Robert Kazinsky]], Max Martini, and Ron Perlman. 

The film is set in the 2020s, when humanity is under attack by "[[kaiju|Kaijus]]", colossal [[monster]]s which have emerged from the Pacific Ocean. To combat the creatures, humanity unites to create the [[Jaeger (pacific rim)|]]s: gigantic humanoid [[mecha]], each controlled by two or more pilots whose minds are joined by a neural bridge.

A sequel called [[Pacific Rim: Uprising]] was released worldwide in March 2018. An animated series titled [[Pacific Rim: The Black]] was released in 2021.

According to Mexican director Guillermo del Toro, the film was heavily influenced by the old Toho [[tokusatsu]] monster films like [[Godzilla]] as well as classic [[super robot]] anime shows like [[Tetsujin 28-Gou]] and [[Mazinger Z]].

Insectoid enemy faction in [[Helldivers (series)|Helldivers 2]]. Based heavily on the [[arachnid (starship troopers)|Arachnids/Bugs]] from [[Starship Troopers]], with one notable difference being that they are harvested by Super Earth for an oil-like substance.

title: melanie_hue_carbine
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985.

[b]Melanie Hue Carbine[/b] is the cunning and ambitious chairman of [[Anaheim Electronics]] during [i]The Gryps War[/i]. 

A crafty and clever "war merchant" who sells [[mobile suit]]s to both sides of the conflict (the [[AEUG]] and the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]), he is known to be shy of the media.
other_names: メラニー・ヒュー・カーバイン

title: re-gz
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Char's Counterattack]] anime film from 1988.

[b]RGZ-91 Re-GZ[/b]

An attempt by [[Anaheim Electronics]] to cheapen and simplify the [[Zeta Plus]] [[mobile suit]] - resulting in the [b]Re[/b]fined [b]G[/b]undam [b]Z[/b]eta, a new MS deployed by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [i]Londo Bell[/i] fleet. 

Omitting the transformation mechanism in favor of a backpack that enabled a simulated [[Wave Rider]] Mode, it ultimately didn't perform as expected, and the data obtained from the two prototypes - one piloted by [[Amuro Ray]] and [[Chan Agi]] - helped to create the first mass production transformable MS of the Federation - the [[ReZEL]].

title: stalker_(helldivers)
body: Enemies from the [[Helldivers (series)|]] franchise. Stalkers are [[Terminid (helldivers)|Terminid/Bug]] specialized in hit-and-run tactics, often dishing out massive damage against an unsuspecting target. They can flee and cloak themselves with a near-invisible camouflage to their surrounding.

title: bile_titan
body: Enemies from [[Helldivers (series)|Helldivers 2]]. An enormous [[Terminid (helldivers)|]] that is said to be the final life cycle stage of a Bile Warrior. It vomits its lethal bile to its target or use is hulking claws to crush them.

title: charger_(helldivers)
body: Enemies from [[Helldivers (series)|Helldivers 2]]. They are large brutish [[Terminid (helldivers)|]]s capable of charging recklessly against their targets.

title: hive_guard_(helldivers)
body: A medium sized [[terminid_(helldivers)|Terminid]] enemy in the second [[Helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] game. They are a variant of the Warrior boasting a tough hide and specializes in guarding Terminid territory.

title: eagle_1_(helldivers)
body: Artist interpretation of the female pilot of [[Eagle_1_(helldivers)|Eagle-1]], the fire support gunship that makes bombing or attack runs when Stratagems are used in [[helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] franchise.  Portrayed as ''extremely'' trigger-happy, especially compared to the pilot of [[Pelican_1_(helldivers)|Pelican-1]].

title: pelican_1_(helldivers)
body: Artist interpretation of the pilot of the Pelican-1, the main extraction dropship used in [[helldivers_(series)|Helldivers]] franchise.  Usually portrayed as calmer and less trigger-happy than the pilot of [[eagle_1_(helldivers)|Eagle-1]].

body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Her real name is [[Nakagawa Nana]], with "Yuki Setsuna" being a stage name. She uses that name to hide the fact that she is Nijigasaki's Student Council President (until she is succeeded by [[Mifune Shioriko]] later in the story) and from her family. She's very fond of anime and gaming culture, but she's also very energetic and easily excitable.  

She has [[black eyes|black]] or [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and styled with [[one side up]] and worn with a [[triangle hair ornament]] in her school uniform.

She is a member of [[azuna (love live!)|A・ZU・NA]].

body:

[spoilers]At the end of the Middle Ages chapter, it is revealed that [[Oersted]] renounced his former ties and titles from Lucrece and took on the name "Odio", becoming the next Lord of Dark after losing the faith of those he loved and a lack of those to believe in him. One of the playable characters for the Final Chapter if Oersted is chosen as the protagonist.[/spoilers]

He is voiced by [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] in the 2022 remake.

body:
The final form of [[Kamen Rider Tycoon]], clad in [[black armor]] and a [[cape]] alongside a [[katana]] inside a [[sheath]].

After [spoiler]the death of his sister, caused by her transformation into a Jyamato,[/spoiler] the once idealistic and eager [[Sakurai Keiwa]] is consumed by unyielding rage, and pressures [[tsumuri (Kamen rider geats)|Tsumuri]] into creating the BujinSword Buckle so that he may wield its overwhelming power to exact merciless vengeance.
other_names: 仮面ライダータイクーンブジンソード

title: kamen_rider_double
body:
Lead Rider of [[Kamen Rider W]], twentieth show of the Kamen Rider series and eleventh of the Heisei generation.

Self-proclaimed "hard-boiled" private eye [[Hidari Shoutarou]] and his enigmatic assistant [[philip_(kamen_rider)|Philip]] combat Dopants, humans turned into monsters via [[Gaia Memory|Gaia Memories]] to wreak havoc in the city of Fuuto, using their "true" Gaia Memories and the Double Driver to merge into Double.

Double has two halves split down the middle, with Shotaro forming the body and left half, and Philip the mind and right half. Each half has 3 forms, making for 9 combinations, of which the most prominent is CycloneJoker. Other forms include FangJoker (where Philip becomes the body and Shotaro being the mind) and CycloneJoker Xtreme (with both men merged as one).

title: kamen_rider_skull
body:
The Rider form assumed by Detective [[Narumi Sokichi]] in [[Kamen Rider W]].

Kamen Rider Skull's head resembles a human skull wearing a white fedora and a muffler around his neck.

title: kamen_rider_diend
body: Kamen Rider Diend is the secondary Rider of [[kamen_rider_dcd|Kamen Rider Decade]]. Diend has a cyan-and-black color scheme and is patterned after a [i]zicrona caerulea[/i], a cerulean species of shield bugs (Decade is patterned after the pink [i]graphosoma lineatum[/i]), as well as barcodes.
other_names: 仮面ライダーディエンド

title: kamen_rider_kuuga_(ultimate_form)
body:
[[Kamen Rider Kuuga]]'s final form. In this form, he gains a black-colored body with [[spikes]] on the shoulders, forearms and lower part of the legs, a headpiece with [[multiple horns|five horns]], a mouthpiece with sharp, fanged design, and the Amadam stone in the [[rider belt|Arcle]] is now black-colored. The eyes has differing colors as a sign if Kuuga is in full control of his powers in this form or not: [[red eyes|Red]] (similar to Mighty Form) for the former, and [[black eyes|black]] for the latter. 

This form is also the combination of all of Kuuga's previous forms' power without the weaknesses present on them (such as Pegasus Form's sensory overload) and his parameters are much higher, becoming as powerful as [[N-Daguva-Zeba]]. He also has the ability to use any of his previous forms' weapons and possess some abilities that Daguva also uses, such as [[pyrokinesis]], the ability to see human forms of every Gurongi, and the ability to break defenses no matter how strong they are and draw blood in his attacks. It is said that his finishing move, the [i][[rider kick|Ultimate Kick]][/i], can destroy the world if used at full power.

However, using this form puts Kuuga at risk of losing control and becoming a monster bent on destruction like Daguva. It can only be fully controlled if he possess a pure heart. 

Being the first Final Form of the Heisei-era Kamen Riders and beyond, succeeding Riders' Final Forms are also nicknamed "Ultimate Form/s" in its honor.
other_names: アルティメットフォーム

title: kemomimi-chan_(naga_u)
body:
[[Naga U]]'s [[original]] character.

She is a girl with [[fox ears]] and [[fox_tail|tail]], typically drawn with [[chibi|compact proportions]]. Her hands are always hidden by her long sleeves. Whenever her ears would be covered, they somehow poke through even the hardest of materials. 

Her favorite food seems to be [[boned meat]]. 

She tends to be drawn as whatever the artist wants and thus, has many forms. Her alternate forms include:

* [[nezumimi-chan_(naga_u)|Nezumimi-chan]]: A [[mouse girl]] version of Kemomimi-chan.
* [[kemomimi-chan_(fish)_(naga_u)|Kemomimi-chan Fish]]: Kemomimi-chan [[animalization|as a]] [[fish]]. A common occurence. (post #3302806)
* Kemomimi-chan? (question mark included): A [[raccoon_girl|tanuki girl]] version of Kemomimi-chan. (post #3316944)
* Another Kemomimi-chan and Black Kemomimi-chan: Palette swaps of Kemomimi-chan. Another has red hair, blue eyes, a blue collar and the red her outfit has been replaced by more green. Black has darker skin, dark green hair, red eyes and a black and white outfit. They also wear conventional thighhighs and shoes.
* "-chan": Kemomimi-chan [[no_animal_ears|without the Kemomimi]]. (post #3323503)
* Kemomimi-san: Kemomimi-chan when she isn't drawn as a chibi. Can also be named Kemomimi-chan-san. (post #4519573)
* [[Year of the Rabbit]] Kemomimi-chan: A [[rabbit girl]] verson of Kemomimi-chan with [[white hair]]. Wears a white and red version of Kemomimi-chan's usual outfit as well as [[twin braids]]. (post #6131672)


h4. Appearance

* !post #2911489: Default
* !post #2795027: Summer outfit
* !post #5038900: Winter outfit

title: planetarium
body:
A [b]planetarium[/b] (plural [b]planetaria[/b] or [i][[ranguage|planetariums]][/i]) is a [[theater]] built primarily for presenting educational and entertaining shows about [[astronomy]] and the [[night sky]], or for training in celestial navigation. A dominant feature of most planetaria is the large [[dome]]-shaped projection screen onto which scenes of [[star_(sky)|stars]], [[planet|planets]] and other celestial objects can be made to appear and move realistically to simulate the complex "motions of the heavens".

Can also be used to describe an object that projects star-like lights on a surface (such as the ceiling). 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Planetarium":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planetarium

title: star_of_lakshmi
body:

h4. See also

title: rika_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Rika[/b], known as [b]Chili[/b] (チリ) in Japan, is a member of Elite Four of the Paldea region in [[Pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]]. She also serves as the receptionist for the Pokémon League, interviewing the player during the first part of the Champion Assessment. She specializes in Ground-type Pokémon, her ace being [[Clodsire]].

She has a laidback and easygoing personality. In the original Japanese she speaks in the [[kansaiben|Kansai dialect]], though she will temporarily drop it when conducting the interview. She refers to the player as "kiddo" and has a distinct "nahaha" laugh.

Owing to her Japanese name, she is popularly represented by the 🌶️ (chili pepper) emoji among Japanese fanartists.

h4. Official art

* !post #7368822: [[Rika (pokemon)|Default]]

h4. External links

title: gustavo_fring
body:
The main antagonist of [i][[Breaking Bad]][/i], and a major character from its prequel [i][[Better Call Saul]][/i]. 

Portrayed by [[Giancarlo Esposito]].

Gustavo "Gus" Fring, also referred to as the Chicken Man and the Chilean, is a Chilean-American restaurant entrepreneur that uses his stores as a front for the drug trade. He is the proprietor of [[Los Pollos Hermanos]], a highly successful fried chicken restaurant chain. Gus is also a public booster for the Drug Enforcement Administration office in Albuquerque, New Mexico, as well as a member of the hospital board. Despite outward appearances, Gus is a major drug kingpin initially affiliated with the Cartel, who uses his restaurants as a front for methamphetamine distribution throughout the American southwest, before later fronting his own drug empire. Like Walter White, Gus is a criminal who "hides in plain sight," using his anti-drug philanthropy to conceal his true nature.

title: walter_white_screaming_in_car_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a scene in [[Breaking Bad]]. The original scene involves [[Walter White]] yelling at his brother-in-law [[Hank Schrader]] to warn him about the men that were sent to kill him.

Parodies of this scene first originated from [[4chan]] post parodying a scene in [[Breaking Bad]] where Walter White yells from a car window at Hank to get sweet and sour sauce, not barbeque.  It later spawning a meme format in which Walt tries to warn Hank of various things.

title: walter_white_breaks_down_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a scene in [[Breaking Bad]] where [[Walter White]] stares in shock before collapsing to the ground after [spoilers]witnessing the murder of his brother-in-law [[Hank Schrader|Hank]][/spoilers].

h4. See also
* [[Breaking Bad]]

She teases her brother, a former demon lord, who lost his power by calling him a [[zako (phrase)|]].

title: kepi
body:
A kind of [[hat]] that has a [[flat cap|flat]] top and cylindrical in shape, with a visor. This hat is mainly associated with the French forces, with its use going back to the 1850s. Many countries used it in the late 19th to early 20th centuries (including France, Japan, Brazil, Austria-Hungary, Romania, and Italy). Philippe Petain and Charles de Gaulle wore one in their official portraits during WWII.

h4. Examples

* !post #4188741

h4. See also

* [[shako cap]]
* [[field cap]]
* [[Tag group:Headwear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kepi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kepi]

title: shako_cap
body:
A tall, cylindrical [[military hat]], usually with a visor, sometimes tapered at the top. It is usually adorned with some kind of ornamental plate or badge on the front, and often has a [[feathers|feather]], [[plume]], or [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pompom]] attached at the top. This can also be used when characters are in a [[marching band]] and wearing this cap.

Take care not to confuse for a [[top hat]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6042432

h4. See also

* [[mini shako cap]]
* [[kepi]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
* [[Tag Group:Headwear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shako":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shako

title: nagato_yuki-chan_no_shoushitsu
body:
A spinoff manga series of [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Shoushitsu]] by [[Puyo (puyotopia)|]]. An anime adaptation by Satelight aired in Spring 2015.

The series takes place in the alternative world found in Suzumiya Haruhi no Shoushitsu and stars [[Nagato Yuki]], whose personality in this series is a mix of the shy Nagato from Shoushitsu and the gamer Nagato from [[Suzumiya Haruhi-chan no Yuuutsu]] (also created by Puyo).

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2017)
body:
The 2017 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] version of [[Hatsune Miku]]. This year was the 10th anniversary of Hatsune Miku.

She was illustrated by [[iXima]]. She has circular, winged [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], a [[white shirt]] with white [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and holds a winged [[microphone wand]].

Her theme song is [[Suna no Wakusei (vocaloid)|]] by [[yonezu kenshi|Hachi]]. As such, she is often paired with the version of Miku portrayed in the song's PV.

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2018)
body:
The 2018 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] version of [[Hatsune Miku]]. Her fan-nickname is "Furikake-chan".

She was illustrated by [[mika pikazo]] and has a vivid neon color palette. She wears a white [[sleeveless shirt]], aqua [[hoop skirt]], black [[detached sleeves]] and [[thighhighs]], all of which are adorned with [[bowtie|bowties]]. She has [[headphones]] around her wrists and holds a [[megaphone]] stand to which balloons are attached. The balloons have the numbers [[39]] and 01 printed on them.

Her theme song is [[Greenlights Serenade (vocaloid)|]] by Omoi.

h4. Official art

title: fly_me_to_the_moon
body:
[b]Fly Me to the Moon[/b], originally called [i]In Other Words[/i], is a 1954 Jazz song written by Bart Howard. While the song was first recorded by Kaye Ballard, it has been performed by many others, with its most famous rendition being the one sung by [[Frank Sinatra]] in 1964.

Notable to anime fans for being the ending song of [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], performed by various artists, including some of the voice actors.

title: kamiha_magica_idol_costume
body:
A costume belonging to the fictional [[idol]] group Kamiha☆Magica in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]], first introduced in its gag comic, Magia Report (pool #12770). See post #3853578 for designs.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[center frills|center]] [[frilled shirt|frills]], a [[collared shirt|collar]] and [[short sleeves]] ([[tied sleeves|tied]] and [[puffy short sleeves|puffy]] for most members, though Rena wears [[pleated sleeves|pleated]] ones instead), a [[neck ribbon]], a [[gingham]] [[underbust]] [[corset]] with a [[yellow flower|yellow]] [[flower symbol]] (or rather a blue [[star (symbol)|]] in Kuroe's case), a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[gingham skirt|gingham]] [[miniskirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]] and a [[back bow]], [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], white legwear of sorts (see below for exact types for each member) and [[strappy heels|heeled]] [[mary janes]] with [[footwear bow|bows]]. The color of the outfit depends on the member. 

h4. Notable members:
* [[Ayano Rika]] (red theme, [[kneehighs]])
* [[Kuroe (madoka magica)|]] (purple theme, [[kneehighs]]. Also substitutes the yellow flower for a blue [[star (symbol)|]])
* [[Minami Rena]] (blue theme, [[thighhighs]]. Also substitutes the puffy short sleeves for [[pleated sleeves]])
* [[Natsume Kako]] (green theme, [[frilled socks]])
* [[Tamaki Iroha]] (pink theme, [[white thighhighs|thighhighs]])

Usually includes a bright pastel colored background as well. Though it is not as visible in [[greyscale]] [[comic]]s.

Do not confuse with simpler background tags like [[heart background|heart]] and [[sparkle background]], or tags like [[sparkling aura| sparkling]], [[loving aura|loving]], and [[happy aura]] where it is only one component around a specific subject.

title: originium_(arknights)
body:
A black [[crystal]]line mineral that manifested as a result of the Catastrophes that ravaged the world of [[Arknights]]. It is useful as a power source, among other things, but overexposure causes "oripathy", which is the source of the [[oripathy lesion (arknights)|]]s seen on some characters, and may be fatal if exposed for a long period of time. Commonly depicted as black crystals.

In game, a special form of originium called [[originite prime (arknights)|]] is used as the premium currency for buying skins and pulling characters from the gacha system.

It is based on the tiberium, a (usually) green crystal from [i][[Command & Conquer]][/i] series, of which the originium shared several characteristic with.

h4. External links

* "Arknights Wiki: Originium":[https://arknights.wiki.gg/Originium]

title: ags-30
body:
The [b]AGS-30[/b] [i]Atlant[/i] is a Russian-designed automatic [[grenade launcher]]. Introduced in 1995, currently in production in the Russian Federation and in service with the [[russian ground forces|Russian]] [[military|armed forces]].

Designed as the improvement of "AGS-17":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AGS-17], the AGS-30 provides better mobility, longer range and better accuracy during firing. Significantly lighter than its previous version, the AGS-30 weighs 30 kg loaded, meaning it can be carried by one person. Using a specially designed GPD-30 [[ammunition|grenade]] (30×29mm), the AGS-30 can engage targets at 2100m.

It is usually mounted on a [[tripod]] or a [[turret]], or used as part of a remotely controlled [[weapon]] system, mounted on various [[military vehicle|combat vehicles]].

h4. See also

* [[Mk19 grenade launcher]] (the US "counterpart")
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Rosoboronexport":[http://roe.ru/esp/catalog/fondos-especiales/spetsgranatomety-y-municiones/ags-30/]

title: a-545
body:
The [b]A-545[/b] (Автомат-545) is a successor line of sorts to the [[AEK-971]] and [[AEK-973]] assault rifle lines which saw limited service with [[Russian ground forces|Russian forces]]. It has a variant chambered for 7.62×39mm called the [b]A-762[/b].

Similar to the AEK-971 and 973, the A-545 controls and layout are heavily based on a normal [[ kalashnikov rifle |AK's]]. However, the A-545 features the BARS system (Balanced Automatic Recoil System), which shifts the mass toward the muzzle as the bolt and bolt carrier are recoiling rearward by way of a counterweight, negating the impulse of the gas piston and bolt carrier which results in more controllable automatic fire. The A-545 and A-762 come with one [[Picatinny Rail]] that runs along the top of the receiver. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

title: 9m133_kornet
body:
The 9M133 Kornet (Russian: Корнет; "Cornet", NATO reporting name AT-14 Spriggan) is a [[Russian ground forces|Russian]] man-portable [[anti-tank missile|anti-tank guided missile]] (ATGM) intended for use against [[tank|main battle tanks]]. The 9M133 missile together with its 9P163-1 tripod launcher and 1PN79-1 thermal sight (part of the 1P45-1 guidance device), form the 9K135 missile system, which can be carried and operated by a two-person infantry crew. 

In addition to an infantry portable version, the 9K133 system has been integrated into a variety of other vehicles and weapons systems as either an upgrade package or a new weapon system. The Kornet has been widely exported and is produced under license in several countries. It was first used in combat in 2003 and has since been used in many conflicts.

title: mikey_simon
body:
Michael Alexander "Mikey" Simon is the titular protagonist of [[Kappa Mikey]]. He is a 19-year-old American from Cleveland, Ohio and is the only American main character on LilyMu.

The main joke of the series is that while Mikey is drawn in a typical American cartoon form (thicker outlines, round eyes, large head, only eight fingers), his Japanese co-stars are drawn in a traditional anime style (thinner outlines, more detail, large eyes and mouth, all 10 fingers; use of various face-faults).

title: kappa_mikey
body:
Kappa Mikey is an American animated comedy television series created by Larry Schwarz for [[Nickelodeon|Nicktoons]] Network. Despite airing on the channel, it was not a Nicktoon, being produced by Schwarz's production company Animation Collective. The series ran from February 25, 2006, to September 20, 2008, with repeats until November 29, 2010, across two seasons.52 22-minute episodes were produced.
Intended as a parody of Japanese anime, the series follows a young American actor named [[Mikey Simon]] whose appearance is "rendered in a thick-line, pop-graphic, American cartoon style". He travels to [[Japan]] to star in a [[tokusatsu]] show called LilyMu, where his anime-influenced co-stars represent common anime clichés.

title: pentagram
body:
A five-pointed [[star (symbol)|]] drawn with five straight lines.

Can (but not always) contain within itself, but not to be confused with, a [[pentagon_(shape)|pentagon]].

Wiccans (a modern [[witch]] religion) use a pentagram with three points up as a holy symbol, often drawn within a circle, while Satanists use a [[inverted pentagram]], often inscribed in a double circle with the head of a [[goat]] inside the pentagram.

In Japanese culture, this symbol (五芒星) is strongly associated with "[i]Abe no Seimei[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abe_no_Seimei, Japan's most renowned "onmyouji":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onmy%C5%8Dji.

title: kuznetsov-class_aircraft_carrier
body:
A class of three [[aircraft carrier]]s built in the later days of the [[Soviet]] Union. Originally two were planned, which only one, the [[Admiral Kuznetsov (aircraft Carrier)|]], was completed for [[Soviet navy]] service. 

The second ship, later known as [[Liaoning (aircraft carrier)|]], was left unfinished in Ukraine after the fall of USSR until sold to [[China]] under a guise for a floating casino in 1998, and were then later rebuilt as a functional carrier. The third ship, [[Shandong (aircraft carrier)|]], is a reverse-engineered version of the ship that were laid down in 2015 and completed in 2019.

Currently, all three ships of the class are currently in service. One with the [[Russian Navy]] and two with the [[People's Liberation Army Navy]].

This is a catchall tag for the ship class. If the individual ship can be identified, then the tag for each ship should be applied accordingly.

title: yamato_(battleship)
body:
[b]Yamato[/b] was a massive battleship of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], active during [[World War II]]. The Yamato-class displaced 72000 tonnes, carried 46 cm (18.1 inch) guns and boasted a great amount of armor, with the waterline belt alone reaching 41 cm in thickness. They were the largest battleships commissioned by any navy during WWII.

Designed between 1934 and 1936, her keel was laid down on 4 November 1937 and she was launched on 8 August 1940. Yamato wasn't commissioned until 16 December 1941, just over a week after the Pearl Harbor attack. Secrecy was maintained throughout her construction with canopies erected at the slipway to hide her from view. Her commissioning was only a simple ceremony and even after completion multiple other warships were docked in a strategic manner to hide her from being seen.

Yamato was also known for her high level of luxury for an IJN battleship, as she was designed as the flagship of the Combined Fleet. She sported ice cream machines, ramune machines, large baths and lockers for all crew. The crewmen slept in bunks rather than tatami like most IJN warships. Yamato was also fully air-conditioned. These luxurious fitting, as well as her rather unimpressive battle record for a ship of her size ended up giving her the nickname "Yamato Hotel".

Alongside her famed 46 cm guns, Yamato was initially equipped with 15.5 cm guns in four triple turrets. By 1945 she had the two 15.5 cm beam turrets removed in favor of more anti-air guns to combat the ever increasing threat of aerial attacks. She only fired her massive main guns once during the Battle off Samar. Yamato never got to fight any other battleship as she was designed for, as carriers and naval aviation became more prevalent. This was perfectly demonstrated when she sank in [[Operation Ten-gou]], after being attacked by over 400 US Navy airplanes.

Today, Yamato appears in numerous media, including anime like [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] and [[Strike Witches]] and personified as a human in [[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]] and [[Kantai Collection]].

h4. See also

* [[Yamato (Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio)|]] ([[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]])

title: tsuba_(guard)
body:
The [b]tsuba (鐔 or 鍔)[/b] is usually a round or occasionally squarish guard at the end of the grip of bladed Japanese weapons, like the "[[katana]]" and its various declinations ("tachi", "wakizashi" etc.), "tanto", or "naginata". They contribute to the control of the arm (the right index of the fighter typically touches the "tsuba"), and to the protection of the hand.

The most common shapes of tsuba are [i]round (maru gata)[/i], [i]rounded-square (kaku gata)[/i] and [i]four lobed (mokko)[/i] with many variations within each basic design.

h4. See also

title: katana
body:
A type of Japanese [[sword]] ([i]nihontou[/i]), and is often called a "samurai sword" because of its historical associations with feudal-era Japan.

The katana is characterized by its distinctive appearance: a curved, slender, single-edged blade, circular or squared [[tsuba (guard)|guard]], and long grip to accommodate two hands (the hilt is often given a distinctive wrapping of silk known as [i][[tsuka-ito|tsukaito]][/i]).

The sword preceding the katana is called a [[tachi (weapon)|]]. The general difference between a tachi and a katana is how they are carried. The tachi is suspended from one’s waist belt with the cutting edge facing down, while the katana is thrust through the waist belt, edge facing up. Also, in general the tachi is more curved and longer than the katana.

title: f91_gundam
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam F91]] anime film from 1991.

[b]F91 Gundam F91[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] experimental miniaturized [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the F (Formula) Project, intended to downsize and reduce the costs of MSs to break [[Anaheim Electronics]]'s monopoly over them. It was much smaller than its predecessors, but had even more powerful thrusters, granting it fantastic mobility. 

It could carry the ferocious and extremely destructive Variable Speed Beam Rifles, and its [[psycho_frame|biocomputer]] enabled a greater link of pilot and machine. The full-spec unit was piloted by [[Seabook Arno]] against the evil [[Crossbone Vanguard]].

title: vault_boy
body:
Mascot of the Vault-tec company, a major technological developer of the [[Fallout]] universe, before that world's atomic apocalypse. This is also the mascot of all the game's perks and traits. In the [[fallout (prime video)|Fallout TV series]], it is revealed the Vault Boy was inspired by [[the ghoul (fallout tv series)|Cooper Howard]], who was the original mascot and spokesperson for Vault-tec.

The Vault Boy and the "T51-b Power Armor" are the two most iconic elements in the [[Fallout]] series.

title: homurabara_academy_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by high school students at Homurabara Academy in [[Fate/stay night]] and [[Fate/kaleid liner PRISMA ILLYA]].

The male uniform consists of a [[brown jacket]] with a [[breast pocket]] and [[brown pants]].

The female uniform consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[brown vest]] (or sometimes a [[brown jacket]]), a [[black skirt|black]] or [[brown skirt|brown]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[medium skirt]], and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]] with a [[cross print]] on it.
