title: homurabara_academy_elementary_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by elementary school students at the Homurabara Academy in [[Fate/kaleid liner PRISMA ILLYA]].

The elementary school uniform is very similar to that of the high school division, but all skirts are black pleated [[miniskirt]]s. However, [i]PRISMA☆ILLYA[/i] mostly depicts the [[summer uniform]] which consists of:

* A [[white headwear|white]] [[hat]].
* A [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[white sailor collar]].
* A [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]] with a [[cross print]] on it.
* A [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]].
* [[Brown footwear|Brown]] [[loafers]].

title: hawaiian_pizza
body:
A Hawaiian pizza, also known as pineapple pizza, is a [[pizza]] topped with [[pineapple]], ham (or Canadian bacon/salame/etc), tomato sauce and cheese.

The dish tends to spark debate regarding the inclusion of [[pineapple on pizza]].

Despite what the name might suggest (which was actually inspired by the canned pineapple brand used by the pizza's inventor at the time), it was invented in Canada by the Greek immigrant Sotirios "Sam" Panopoulos.

body: Humans who survived the nuclear bombings in [[Fallout]] but were mutated, burning their skin until it [[wrinkled skin|wrinkled]] and lost their hair. Some ghouls have maintained their sanity but others have turned feral, more resembling [[zombie]]s.

title: fallout_2
body:
The second game in the [[Fallout]] series, and the sequel to [[Fallout 1]].

The game takes place in 2241, 80 years after the events of [[Fallout 1]] and 164 years after the Great War. It follows [[the Chosen One]], a descendant of the [[Vault Dweller]] from Fallout 1, and their quest to save their tribe by finding the Garden of Eden Creation Kit.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Fallout 2":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallout_2]

title: fat_man_(fallout)
body:
The Fat Man is a recurring fictional [[weapon]] in [[Fallout]] series.

The Fat Man is a shoulder-mounted tactical nuclear catapult. It is heavy, but very powerful. First entered service in September 2077 with the U.S. Army. The weapon is presented in different versions throughout the game series.

For the real life atomic bomb which this weapon is based on and named after, use [[Fat Man (bomb)]] instead.

title: vault_suit
body: The Vault Suit is the [[jumpsuit]] worn by Vault dwellers in the [[Fallout]] series. This, along with the [[Pip Boy]], is the standard attire for player characters in the series.

title: fallout_3
body:
Fallout 3 is an action role-playing shooter released by Bethesda Game Studios and the third major game in the [[Fallout]] series. It differs in many ways from its predecessors, [[Fallout 1|Fallout]] and [[Fallout 2]], although core elements from those games ([[Vault Boy]], familiar enemies, etc.) stay mostly untouched.

h4. Characters

* [[Colonel Autumn]]

body: The first [[Fallout]] game, released in 1997. It follows the journey of the [[Vault Dweller]], who travels across the Wasteland in search of a water chip for his vault.

title: feral_ghoul
body:
In the [[Fallout]] series, feral ghouls are irradiated humans that have lost their ability to reason and have become aggressive. Much prejudice from ordinary humans against ghouls who retain their mental faculties is due to the widespread assumption that this feral state is the inevitable condition of every ghoul.

h4. External links

* "Fallout Wikia":http://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Feral_ghoul

title: rebar_club
body:
A large piece of concrete attached to one or more lengths of [[rebar]], fashioned as a [[club (weapon)|]].

Prominently featured in the [[Fallout]] series.

title: nuka_cola
body:
Nuka-Cola is a soft [[drink]] in [[Fallout]].

It is the flagship product of the Nuka-Cola Corporation and one of the symbols of United States culture. Introduced in 2044, it rapidly dominated the soft drink market, eventually becoming the most popular soda on the market and a staple of American culture. In the aftermath of the "Great War":https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/Great_War Nuka-Cola [[bottle cap]]s became the de facto currency in most post-War societies.

title: fat_man_(bomb)
body:
A plutonium-infused [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] developed by the United States as a part of the Manhattan Project. It was used during the [[atomic bombings of hiroshima and nagasaki|Atomic Bombing of Nagasaki]] on 9 August, 1945, destroying the city in the process. Fat Man is the second and last nuclear weapon to ever be used in combat.

Despite its relatively short service life, the Fat Man's appearance has been frequently used in popular culture as a stereotypical depiction of an atomic bomb.

This tag is for the real life nuclear weapon, for a fictional weapon in [[Fallout]] series named and modelled after the Fat Man, see [[Fat Man (Fallout)]].

h4. See also
* [[Demon Core]] - a plutonium sphere meant to be used as a core for a second Fat Man bomb
* [[Little Boy (bomb)]]
